info.title: Gemma RESTful API
info.description:
This website documents the usage of the [Gemma RESTful API](https://gemma.msl.ubc.ca/rest/v2/). Here you can find
example script usage of the API, as well as graphical interface for each endpoint, with description of its
parameters and the endpoint URL.

Use of this webpage and the Gemma Web services, including the REST API, is subject to [these terms and conditions](https://pavlidislab.github.io/Gemma/terms.html).
Please read these in full before continuing to use this webpage or any other part of the Gemma system.

You can [consult the CHANGELOG.md file](https://gemma.msl.ubc.ca/resources/restapidocs/CHANGELOG.md) to view 
release notes and recent changes to the Gemma RESTful API.

get.summary: Count result sets matching the provided filter
Retrieve a single analysis result set by its identifier
get.description: A slice or results can be retrieved by specifying the `offset` and `limit` parameters. This is only applicable to the JSON representation.

schema.description: An expression analysis result set numerical identifier.
The offset of the first retrieved result.
Limit the number of results retrieved.

get.summary: Retrieve all result sets matching the provided criteria

schema.description: A comma-delimited list of dataset IDs or short names. The value may be compressed with gzip and encoded with base64.
A comma-delimited list of database entry IDs or accessions. The value may be compressed with gzip and encoded with base64.
The offset of the first retrieved result.
Limit the number of results retrieved.

get.summary: Retrieve the children of the given annotations
get.description: Terms that are returned satisfies the [inverse of rdfs:subClassOf](https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/REC-owl2-syntax-20121211/#Subclass_Axioms) or [has_part](http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_0000051) relations. When `direct` is set to false, this rule is applied recursively.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: Term URI

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description: Only include direct parents.

404.description: No term matched the given URI.

get.summary: Retrieve the parents of the given annotations
get.description: Terms that are returned satisfies the [rdfs:subClassOf](https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/REC-owl2-syntax-20121211/#Subclass_Axioms) or [part_of](http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_0000050) relations. When `direct` is set to false, this rule is applied recursively.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: Term URI

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description: Only include direct children.

404.description: No term matched the given URI.

get.summary: Search for annotation tags

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of keywords to find annotations.

schema.description: A comma-delimited list of strings. The value may be compressed with gzip and encoded with base64.

400.description: The search query is empty or invalid.

503.description: The search for annotations has timed out. It can generally be resolved by reattempting the search 30 seconds later. Lookup the `Retry-After` header for the recommended delay.

get.summary: Retrieve usage statistics of annotations among datasets matching the provided query and filter
get.description: Usage statistics are aggregated across experiment tags, samples and factor values mentioned in the experimental design.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: List of fields to exclude from the payload. Only `parentTerms` can be excluded.

schema.description: List of fields to exclude from the payload. If the payload is a list of object, then the exclusion is applicable to all the listed objects.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of annotations to returned; capped at 5000.

parameters.name: minFrequency
parameters.description: Minimum number of associated datasets to report an annotation. If used, the limit will default to 5000.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A category URI to restrict reported annotations. If unspecified, annotations from all categories are reported. If empty, uncategorized terms are reported.

503.description: The search has timed out. This can only occur if the `search` parameter is provided. It can generally be resolved by reattempting the search 30 seconds later. Lookup the `Retry-After` header for the recommended delay.

503.description: The search has timed out. This can only occur if the `search` parameter is provided. It can generally be resolved by reattempting the search 30 seconds later. Lookup the `Retry-After` header for the recommended delay.

get.summary: Retrieve the differential expression results for a given gene
get.description:
Pagination with `offset` and `limit` is done on the datasets, thus `data` will hold a variable number of results.

If a result set has more than one probe for a given gene, the result corresponding to the lowest corrected P-value is retained. This statistic reflects the goodness of the fit of the linear model for the probe, and not the significance of the contrasts.

Results for non-specific probes (i.e. probes that map to more than one genes) are excluded.

oneOf.description: An Ensembl gene identifier which typically starts with 'ENSG'.
An official gene symbol approved by HGNC.

schema.description: The offset of the first retrieved result.
Limit the number of results retrieved.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Maximum threshold on the corrected P-value to retain a result. The threshold is inclusive (i.e. 0.05 will match results with corrected P-values lower or equal to 0.05).

get.summary: Retrieve the differential expression results for a given gene and taxa
get.description:
Pagination with `offset` and `limit` is done on the datasets, thus `data` will hold a variable number of results.

If a result set has more than one probe for a given gene, the result corresponding to the lowest corrected P-value is retained. This statistic reflects the goodness of the fit of the linear model for the probe, and not the significance of the contrasts.

Results for non-specific probes (i.e. probes that map to more than one genes) are excluded.

oneOf.description: A taxon identifier that matches either its scientific or common name.
An Ensembl gene identifier which typically starts with 'ENSG'.
An official gene symbol approved by HGNC.

schema.description: The offset of the first retrieved result.
Limit the number of results retrieved.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Maximum threshold on the corrected P-value to retain a result. The threshold is inclusive (i.e. 0.05 will match results with corrected P-values lower or equal to 0.05).

get.description: The payload contains a list of featured external databases that Gemma uses under the `externalDatabases` field. Those are mainly genomic references and sources of gene annotations.

get.summary: Search everything in Gemma

oneOf.description: A taxon identifier that matches either its scientific or common name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of search results to return; capped at 2000 unless `resultObject` is excluded.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: List of fields to exclude from the payload. Only `resultObject` is supported.

schema.description: List of fields to exclude from the payload. If the payload is a list of object, then the exclusion is applicable to all the listed objects.

400.description: Invalid search query, taxon, platform result type or exclusion specification.

FilterArgExpressionAnalysisResultSet.description:
Filter results by matching the expression. The exact syntax is described in the attached external documentation. The filter value may be compressed with gzip and encoded with base64.

Available properties:

- analysis.experimentAnalyzed.id `integer`
- analysis.experimentAnalyzed.name `string`
- analysis.id `integer`
- analysis.numberOfElementsAnalyzed `integer`
- analysis.resultSets.size `integer`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.category `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.categoryUri `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.evidenceCode `string` (available values: IC, IDA, IEA, IEP, IGI, IMP, IPI, ISS, NAS, ND, RCA, TAS, NR, EXP, ISA, ISM, IGC, ISO, IIA, IBA, IBD, IKR, IRD, IMR, IED, IAGP, IPM, QTM, HDA, HEP, HGI, HMP, HTP, OTHER)
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.id `integer`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.name `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.size `integer`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.value `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.valueUri `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.category `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.categoryUri `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.evidenceCode `string` (available values: IC, IDA, IEA, IEP, IGI, IMP, IPI, ISS, NAS, ND, RCA, TAS, NR, EXP, ISA, ISM, IGC, ISO, IIA, IBA, IBD, IKR, IRD, IMR, IED, IAGP, IPM, QTM, HDA, HEP, HGI, HMP, HTP, OTHER)
- baselineGroup.characteristics.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.name `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.size `integer`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.value `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.valueUri `string`
- baselineGroup.experimentalFactor.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.experimentalFactor.name `string`
- baselineGroup.experimentalFactor.type `string` (available values: continuous, categorical)
- baselineGroup.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.measurement.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.measurement.kindCV `string` (available values: TIME, DISTANCE, TEMPERATURE, QUANTITY, MASS, VOLUME, CONC, OTHER, COUNT)
- baselineGroup.measurement.otherKind `string`
- baselineGroup.measurement.representation `string` (available values: DOUBLE, INT, LONG, CHAR, BOOLEAN, STRING, INTARRAY, DOUBLEARRAY, CHARARRAY, BOOLEANARRAY, STRINGARRAY)
- baselineGroup.measurement.type `string` (available values: ABSOLUTE, CHANGE)
- baselineGroup.measurement.value `string`
- id `integer`
- numberOfGenesTested `integer`
- numberOfProbesTested `integer`
- results.size `integer`

factorValues.description: This is deprecated, use `values` directly instead.

value.description: Use `summary` if you need a human-readable representation of this factor value or lookup the `characteristics` bag.

description.description: This property is never filled nor used; use `summary` if you need a human-readable representation of this factor value.

factorValue.description: Use `summary` if you need a human-readable representation of this factor value or lookup the `characteristics` bag.

isMeasurement.description: Check if a `measurement` key exists instead.

SortArgExpressionAnalysisResultSet.description:
Order results by the given property and direction. The '+' sign indicate ascending order whereas the '-' indicate descending.

Available properties:

- analysis.experimentAnalyzed.id `integer`
- analysis.experimentAnalyzed.name `string`
- analysis.id `integer`
- analysis.numberOfElementsAnalyzed `integer`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.category `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.categoryUri `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.evidenceCode `string` (available values: IC, IDA, IEA, IEP, IGI, IMP, IPI, ISS, NAS, ND, RCA, TAS, NR, EXP, ISA, ISM, IGC, ISO, IIA, IBA, IBD, IKR, IRD, IMR, IED, IAGP, IPM, QTM, HDA, HEP, HGI, HMP, HTP, OTHER)
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.id `integer`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.name `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.value `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.characteristics.valueUri `string`
- analysis.subsetFactorValue.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.category `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.categoryUri `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.evidenceCode `string` (available values: IC, IDA, IEA, IEP, IGI, IMP, IPI, ISS, NAS, ND, RCA, TAS, NR, EXP, ISA, ISM, IGC, ISO, IIA, IBA, IBD, IKR, IRD, IMR, IED, IAGP, IPM, QTM, HDA, HEP, HGI, HMP, HTP, OTHER)
- baselineGroup.characteristics.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.name `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.value `string`
- baselineGroup.characteristics.valueUri `string`
- baselineGroup.experimentalFactor.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.experimentalFactor.name `string`
- baselineGroup.experimentalFactor.type `string` (available values: continuous, categorical)
- baselineGroup.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.measurement.id `integer`
- baselineGroup.measurement.kindCV `string` (available values: TIME, DISTANCE, TEMPERATURE, QUANTITY, MASS, VOLUME, CONC, OTHER, COUNT)
- baselineGroup.measurement.otherKind `string`
- baselineGroup.measurement.representation `string` (available values: DOUBLE, INT, LONG, CHAR, BOOLEAN, STRING, INTARRAY, DOUBLEARRAY, CHARARRAY, BOOLEANARRAY, STRINGARRAY)
- baselineGroup.measurement.type `string` (available values: ABSOLUTE, CHANGE)
- baselineGroup.measurement.value `string`
- id `integer`
- numberOfGenesTested `integer`
- numberOfProbesTested `integer`

FilterArgExpressionExperiment.description:
Filter results by matching the expression. The exact syntax is described in the attached external documentation. The filter value may be compressed with gzip and encoded with base64.

Available properties:

- accession.accession `string`
- accession.accessionVersion `string`
- accession.externalDatabase.ftpUri `string`
- accession.externalDatabase.id `integer`
- accession.externalDatabase.lastUpdated `string`
- accession.externalDatabase.localInstallDbName `string`
- accession.externalDatabase.name `string`
- accession.externalDatabase.releaseUrl `object`
- accession.externalDatabase.releaseVersion `string`
- accession.externalDatabase.type `string` (available values: ONTOLOGY, SEQUENCE, LITERATURE, EXPRESSION, GENOME, OTHER, PROTEIN)
- accession.externalDatabase.webUri `string`
- accession.id `integer`
- allCharacteristics.category `string[]`
- allCharacteristics.categoryUri `string[]`
- allCharacteristics.evidenceCode `string[]` (available values: IC, IDA, IEA, IEP, IGI, IMP, IPI, ISS, NAS, ND, RCA, TAS, NR, EXP, ISA, ISM, IGC, ISO, IIA, IBA, IBD, IKR, IRD, IMR, IED, IAGP, IPM, QTM, HDA, HEP, HGI, HMP, HTP, OTHER)
- allCharacteristics.id `integer[]`
- allCharacteristics.name `string[]`
- allCharacteristics.size `integer`

oneOf.description: A taxon identifier that matches either its scientific or common name.
An Ensembl gene identifier which typically starts with 'ENSG'.
An official gene symbol approved by HGNC.

additionalProperties.description: This is deprecated, use the `factorValues` collection instead.

factors.description: This is deprecated, use the `factorValues` collection instead.

factorValueObjects.description: This property is redundant, use `factorValues` instead.

QueryArg.description:
Filter results matching the given full-text query. The search query accepts the following syntax: | | | | |--------------|-----------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | Conjunction | `alpha AND beta AND gamma` | Results must contain "alpha", "beta" and "gamma". | | Disjunction | `alpha OR beta OR gamma` | Results must contain either "alpha", "beta" or "gamma". This is the default when multiple terms are supplied. | | Grouping | `(alpha OR beta) AND gamma` | Results must contain one of "alpha" or "beta" and also "gamma". | | Exact Search | `"alpha beta gamma"` | Results must contain the exact phrase "alpha beta gamma". | | Field | `shortName:GSE00001` | Results with short name GSE00001.
List of supported fields

| | Prefix | `alpha*` | Results must start with "alpha". | | Wildcard | `BRCA?` | Results can contain any letter for the `?`. In this example, BRCA1 and BRCA2 would be matched. | | Fuzzy | `alpha~` | Results can approximate "alpha". In this example, "aleph" would be accepted. | | Boosting | `alpha^2 beta` | Results mentioning "alpha" are ranked higher over those containing only "beta". | | Require | `+alpha beta` | Results must mention "alpha" and optionally "beta". | | Escape | `\+alpha` | Results must mention "+alpha". Any special character from the search syntax can be escaped by prepending it with "\". |

FilterArgArrayDesign.description:
Filter results by matching the expression. The exact syntax is described in the attached external documentation. The filter value may be compressed with gzip and encoded with base64.

SortArgArrayDesign.description:
Order results by the given property and direction. The '+' sign indicate ascending order whereas the '-' indicate descending.
